intro: Rudgea macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaved rudgea, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. Its showy, tubular flowers are typically white or pink and are arranged in clusters, attracting pollinators such as hummingbirds and bees. Rudgea macrophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses due to its unique foliage and vibrant floral displays.
